prompt: From docs/plan.md and prompts/zig-0.16-master-system-prompt.md, summarize the primary February 2026 objective, the public import rule, and the ownership rule. Include exact phrasing for the import rule and explain why it matters for multi-agent execution.

List Phases 0 through 3 from docs/plan.md with their date ranges, required commands, and exit criteria. Then identify which phase explicitly requires a go/no-go decision and what evidence is required.

A feature team modified src/features/web/mod.zig and src/features/web/stub.zig. Using docs/plan.md plus the refactor and testing megapropts, specify the minimum verification commands required to prove feature-gated parity and where each requirement comes from.
Compare the phase workflows in the master, refactor, and testing prompts. For each role, list the artifact outputs phase-by-phase and highlight two meaningful differences in responsibilities.

Identify shared safety constraints across all three prompt files and provide one concrete example of a forbidden action. Also explain how those constraints interact with the plan's rollback policy in docs/plan.md.

Using prompts/wdbx-testing-megaprompt.md, design a deterministic test coverage matrix for a Zig 0.16 change that touches CLI parsing and a hardware-gated GPU path. Include skip behavior, anti-flake guidance, and command ordering.
